title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: It presents a polished ashlar front to the Street, ornamented with string courses, and surmounted by an elegant range of dormer windows, with finials of various design. Over the main entrance, in Boswell's Court, there is a shield bearing a fancy device, with the initials T. L., and the inscription, 0 ■ LORD ■ IN ■ THE ' IS ' AL ' MI ' TRAIST. In a compartment on the left of the shield, there are also the initials I. L., R. W.; a similar compartment on the right is now defaced.1
